author: Simona
text:
UPDATE:

order#: 30620848


  12 days after my review on Trustpilot, Vestiaire finally replied to my email. They refused to refund me. They have shifted all the blame on the transporter, who has also denied to take any responsibility for this mess. According to the transporter the bag 'correctly left the warehouse' and the package's weight was on point - even though the delivery man admitted that parcel felt empty to him when picking it up (this conversation between him and the transporting company dispatcher was recorded). 

 Vestiaire have invited me to file a complaint at the police station and to thereby put on my detective hat and solve this issue by myself somehow. How ridiculous? On Vestiaire's website it clearly states 'all items are insured against theft and accidental damage' and that they 'insure and assume responsibility for all items'. Clearly they do not, as I have been denied a refund. This is false advertising and is illegal. 

29/10/2020

  A month ago I was naive enough to order a Chloe bag (Drew en cuir) from Vestiaire. Oh boy, do I wish I had come here before making my purchase. It took double the stated amount of time for the bag to arrive and I knew something was wrong. Guess what? The bag finally arrived and well... I GOT AN EMPTY BOX FOR 650 EUROS! Somewhere along the way, someone either opened the box and stole the bag, or it was never put inside the delivery box by the seller in the first place. Either way, this happened 17 days ago and I am still waiting for my money. This is unbelievable. The customer support team have not been helpful at all and keep sending me pre-written phrases and responses and ask me to be patient. Excuse me?! I bought the world's most expensive empty box due to your unprofessionalism and you are asking me to be patient?
title: I PAID 650 EUROS FOR AN EMPTY BOX!

author: Amy K
text:
Pros: two stars for having a HUGE inventory which is handy for research if you are hunting something down, and a decent email response when you need help (I agree with another reviewer who said you may not like what they put in the response though). 
Cons: there is so much wrong with Vestiaire's site and app. There is a LOT of poor condition stuff and high street brands that stretch the "designer" definition to inconceivable limits. After getting burned on one purchase (the seller listed it as VG, it was fair at best) I use it purely for research and then go hunt down an item on another marketplace. There is no system for reviewing sellers and comments put under a product (like when someone asks a question) vanish a few weeks after appearing so helpful info gets lost. You've no way of knowing how many times an item has been bought and sold again as they just re-use the same photos. Sellers are not obliged to respond to questions and there's no action taken against them if they falsely represent the condition of an item. The site is buggy - the favourites and wishlist function especially bad (when you remove something it keeps sending you price reduction emails anyway and you can't find a way to turn them off - even several months after removing!). Which leads me to their awful unsubscribe options and lack of a clear data protection officer to contact on their unbsubscribe page. In an attempt to stop the phantom price alerts I tried unsubscribing from everything - when I next logged into the app it had subscribed me again! Epic fail for GDPR compliance there. Finally, the app is extremely buggy on Android. After a few minutes browsing you get a "no internet connection" error. I ended up switching between data and wifi as doing so seemed to trigger it to reconnect again. 
Conclusion: Avoid, avoid, avoid, avoid...
title: Don't bother

author: GDP
text:
The commission percentages (in USD) on the VC site are not correct. As a seller you pay a commission percentage (in EUR) that is higher.
The goods you sell are not authenticated by VC. As a seller you receive a shipping document with the buyer as direct receiver.
VC accepts fake photos sent by the buyer as proof for canceling the sale and “rewards” the seller by taking away his badge as trusted seller.
Think twice, is my advice, before you decide to be a seller on the VC site. I no longer am.
title: SELLER WARNING

author: Olena
text:
Dear all, 
Today was for me the last straw. 
I have been seller and buyer with vestiaire for a few years. 
I am expert seller and ship my items within 24 hours. 
About two month ago I sold Stella McCartney top , reference: 4547154, buyer chose direct shipping, I posted the item the same day it was purchased, only to find out when ups tried to deliver it, address was incorrect. After numerous chats with customer service of vestiaire, two weeks later buyer managed to update correct address.
This Saturday I sold Gucci jacket reference: 11670075, when I printed the label I realised the offer was sent from Romanian account holder but shipping label stated address in Germany . I posted the item on Monday, only to log in today to check , that item was supposed to be delivered today but ups states incorrect address or missing information. So I contacted vestiaire customer service, I had no clear answer how come they don’t verify addresses or customers. 
So now my jacket is in Germany in a limbo without clear indication what will happen now.
Vestiaire leaves sellers in a bad position and open to fraud. 
If I could give zero star I would , that’s after years of spending thousands with them and never had returned items!
Keep away.

author: Olena
text:
Dear all , 
I am vestiaire expert seller and a buyer for the past seven years.
Over the past seven years I bought and sold many items, everything was fine that until they brought direct shipping .
All my items are shipped Monday to Friday within 24 hours after the purchase , in many occasions the same day. I had no returns. 
About two months ago I sold stella McCartney top ref 4547154 , via direct shipping , address provided on the shipping label was wrong and it took buyer two weeks to update and three weeks for me to get paid, that’s after numerous chats with their useless customer service:
On Saturday I sold new Gucci jacket ref : 11670075, offer was sent from Romanian account holder but postage was to Germany, I was sceptical but still shipped the item on Monday morning. 
Only to find out on Wednesday that ups attempted delivery but address is incorrect and they can’t get hold of the buyer. 
So I got in touch with vestiaire straight away but told to wait....
Today Thursday morning I checked ups status: wrong or missing address so I contacted vestiaire and been told I have to wait ; no time scale given and no indication; just wait and if not delivered will be returned to me or if missing I have to open dispute!
So not it is very clear , vestiaire allows their sellers to post direct to the buyers without any due diligence, no proof of address , to the different country , not even to country where account held. So it leaves us sellers wide open to be de frauded! 
I had no clear answers from customer service, I asked for email of their managers, apparently they can’t give it. Unfortunately after seven years and spending thousands with them this company shows luck of KYC and any responsibility.
Avoid!
title: Direct shipping
